Job Details

Job Location

Corporate - CARROLLTON, TX

Position Type

Full Time

Job Shift

Day

Description

Position Summary: As the Vice President of Sales, you will be a pivotal member of our leadership team and will be responsible for overseeing the sales function of the company. You will develop and execute strategic sales initiatives, manage a team of high-performing sales professionals, and collaborate with cross-functional departments to ensure the achievement of sales targets and the overall success of bringing new business into Swiss. This role is full-time on-site office position with some travel.

Responsibilities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities Other duties may be assigned.
• Identify, develop, and capitalize on new, expansion, and renewal business opportunities.
• Evaluate and enhance existing partnerships and sales strategies for optimal performance.
• Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
• Manage key client relationships (especially through onboarding transition to client services) while actively seeking opportunities to establish new ones.
• Expand the company’s profile and brand reach through sales initiatives.
• Lead sales team. In concert, with VP of Marketing & Client Engagement, provide a full suite of service that distinguishes the SA brand of customer service and client relationship.
• Participate with cross-functional New Business Development teams to foster sustainable, long-term growth. Manage the sales funnel.
• Strengthen internal and external relationships to increase lead generation and market share.
• Track emerging markets and trends to inform business decisions and identify new markets for potential expansion.
• Foster and maintain an entrepreneurial growth culture across the organization.
• Propose and develop strategic partnerships to enhance the company’s position.
• Contribute to shaping the company’s long-term Strategic objectives and plans.
• Provide insights on product development, distribution, and promotion strategies.
• Leverage experience in the CDMO industry, preferably in topical applications, to balance risk appropriately.
• Aggressively pursue new business opportunities for the organization.
• Create and execute manufacturing sales strategies with existing resources, both human and digital.
• Manage and develop human and digital resources efficiently.
• Execute programs to promote the business’s needs, to fill production capacity.
• Implement and manage compensation plans, liaising with finance for effective tracking and accurate and precise commission payments.
• Ensure successful execution of quotes through proactive intervention and support.
• Ensure successful execution of Manufacturing, Quality and other agreements, and contract related items, to streamline the process for new business.
• Utilize tools/resources to identify and capitalize on opportunities, such as the potential to produce large quantity runs, or complex pack-outs or new formulations in advance of moving leads through sales funnel
• Develop programs, with input from Operations re: short term capacity gaps, flexibility in filling and packaging configuration, marshaling resources effectively.
• Block and tackle challenges for BD Managers to ensure the successful realization of strategic and tactical goals.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) preferred, or equivalent experience in sales within the Contract Manufacturing Organization (CMO) or Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) industry.
• Minimum four years of demonstrably successful sales experience.
• Extensive knowledge of the CMO/CDMO industry and its dynamics.
• Ability to analyze complex data (technical journals, financial reports, market intelligence) and translate insights into actionable sales strategies.
• Proficiency in building sales plans, setting targets, and developing compelling presentations to win business for internal and external stakeholders.
• Strong analytical skills to build pricing models and quotes that support successful deal negotiations.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills to present complex information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences (customers, prospects, internal stakeholders).
• Ability to build strong relationships and navigate complex conversations.
• Strong social selling skills and a solid understanding of digital marketing tools.
• Proven ability to lead, motivate, and develop a high-performing sales team
• Proficiency in presentation software, communication tools, and collaboration platforms.
